1.brief: a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a pile of rubbish (as contorted), i.e. a ruin

2.brief: to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
Aroer, the name of three places in or near Palestine
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to crouch (on all four legs folded, like a recumbent animal); be implication, to recline, repose, brood, lurk, imbed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to shudder with terror; hence, to fear; also to hasten (with anxiety)

3.brief: to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
dominion, i.e. (abstractly) the estate (rule) or (concretely) the country (realm)
Aram or Syria, and its inhabitants; also the name of the son of Shem, a grandson of Nahor, and of an Israelite
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

4.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to slacken or be feeble; figuratively, to be oppressed
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
fat, i.e. (literally and abstractly) fatness; but usually (figuratively and concretely) a rich dish, a fertile field, a robust man
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
to emaciate, i.e. make (become) thin (literally or figuratively)

5.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)
something that rises, i.e. a stalk of grain
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
a stream (as flowing); also an ear of grain (as growing out); by analogy, a branch
to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, to pick up, i.e. (generally) to gather; specifically, to glean
a stream (as flowing); also an ear of grain (as growing out); by analogy, a branch

6.brief: properly, to swell up, i.e. be (causatively, make) redundant
only in plural gleanings; by extension gleaning-time
an olive (as yielding illuminating oil), the tree, the branch or the berry
a berry (as if a pellet of rumination)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a summit (of a tree or mountain
a fissure (of rocks); also a bough (as subdivided)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

7.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to gaze at or about (properly, for help); by implication, to inspect, consider, compassionate, be nonplussed (as looking around in amazement) or bewildered
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
near, with or among; often in general, to
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

8.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to gaze at or about (properly, for help); by implication, to inspect, consider, compassionate, be nonplussed (as looking around in amazement) or bewildered
near, with or among; often in general, to
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
something to sieze with, i.e. a finger; by analogy, a toe
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
Asherah (or Astarte) a Phoenician goddess; also an image of the same

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
a fortified place; figuratively, a defence
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively)
a plant; collectively, a plantation; abstractly, a planting
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify

11.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a plant; collectively, a plantation; abstractly, a planting
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
to be frail, feeble, or (figuratively) melancholy

12.brief: a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
uproar (as of rushing); by implication, destruction
uproar (as of rushing); by implication, destruction
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
vast, whether in extent (figuratively, of power, mighty; of time, aged), or in number, many
to rush; by implication, to desolate

water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
to rush; by implication, to desolate
to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver)
remoteness, i.e. (concretely) a distant place; often (adverbially) from afar
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
chaff (as pressed out, i.e. winnowed or (rather) threshed loose)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a wheel; by analogy, a whirlwind; also dust (as whirled)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

14.brief: time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
properly, non-occurrence; used adverbially, not yet or before
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment
properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot)
